apply_metadata.description: This action requires two additional parameters within `metadata`: `action` (which can be either `add`, `set`, or `remove`), and `metadata` (the value of the metadata which you'd like to either add or remove to the list of subscribers).
apply_metadata.name: Apply metadata (to subscribers)

apply_tags.description: This action requires two additional parameters within `metadata`: `tag_id` (the ID of the tag which you'd like to either add or remove to the list of subscribers) and `action` (which can be either `add` or `remove`).
apply_tags.name: Apply tags

columns_empty_invalid.description: You must pass in at least one column to export; otherwise, omit the parameter entirely.

publish_date_invalid.description: The publish date provided is not valid or is in an incorrect format.

slug_invalid.description: The slug provided is invalid or already in use.

status_invalid.description: The status provided is not valid.

subject_invalid.description: The subject provided is invalid or missing.
subject_invalid.name: Invalid subject

tag_invalid.description: The tag provided is invalid or does not exist.
tag_invalid.name: Invalid tag

creation_date_invalid.description: The creation date provided is not valid or is in an incorrect format.

publish_date_invalid.description: The publish date provided is not valid or is in an incorrect format.

api.description: This email was created via the API.
api.name: API

app.description: This email was created via the Buttondown web app.
app.name: App

external_feed.description: This email was created by an external RSS feed.
external_feed.name: External feed

import.description: This email was imported from another service.
import.name: Import

about_to_send.description:
This email has been queued to send out to subscribers, and will be sent automatically within a few minutes.

If you're seeing that an email you just sent out is 'stuck' here, worry not — Buttondown sometimes takes a little bit longer to send out emails to ensure deliverability, but once it's marked as 'about to send' it will get sent out.
about_to_send.name: About to send

deleted.description: This email has been deleted, and is no longer visible in your web archives.
deleted.name: Deleted

draft.description: Draft emails are only visible to you and are not sent out to subscribers.
draft.name: Draft

errored.description: This email has encountered an error while sending out to subscribers, and is not visible in your web archives.
errored.name: Errored

imported.description: This email was imported from another service, and is visible in your web archives if enabled.
imported.name: Imported

in_flight.description:
This email is currently being sent out to subscribers, and is visible in your web archives if enabled.

Some emails, especially those with large subscriber lists, may take a while to send out — Buttondown sends emails out in batches to ensure deliverability, so if you're seeing an email 'stuck' here, it's because our systems have detected that that's the optimal way to reach your subscribers.
in_flight.name: In flight

managed_by_rss.description: This email was created by an external feed, and has not yet been finalized and sent out by Buttondown.
managed_by_rss.name: Managed by RSS

paused.description: This email has been paused, and is not visible in your web archives.
paused.name: Paused

resending.description: This email is in the process of automatically being resent to subscribers by Buttondown's systems in order to make sure all subscribers have received it.
resending.name: Resending

scheduled.description: This email has been scheduled to send out to subscribers at a specific time. This specific time is available on the email as its `publish_date`.
scheduled.name: Scheduled

sent.description: This email has been sent out to subscribers, and is visible in your web archives if enabled.
sent.name: Sent

suppressed.description: This email has been suppressed and is not visible to subscribers.
suppressed.name: Suppressed

throttled.description: This email is in the process of being sent out, but is being intentionally sent slowly to ensure deliverability.
throttled.name: Throttled

transactional.description: This email is a transactional email used by a core workflow in your newsletter or Automations, and is not visible in your web archives nor sent out to subscribers.
transactional.name: Transactional

archival.description: Emails that are only available in the archive and not sent to subscribers.
archival.name: Archival

churned.description: Emails sent specifically to subscribers who were previously premium but have since churned.
churned.name: Churned

free.description: Free emails are sent out only to subscribers who are not paying for your newsletter (so you can send specific emails to convince them to pay, for instance!)
free.name: Free

premium.description: Premium emails are sent out to only paying subscribers (including those with gift subscriptions or on a free trial), and only premium subscribers can view them in online archives.
premium.name: Premium

private.description: Private emails are sent out to all of your subscribers but are not viewable in your web archives.
private.name: Private

public.description: Public emails are sent out to all of your subscribers and are available in your web archives.
public.name: Public

error.description: The export was unable to be completed. Buttondown is looking into it.
error.name: Error

in_progress.description: The export is currently being processed.
in_progress.name: In progress

not_started.description: The export has not yet started.
not_started.name: Not started

advertising_slot.purchased.name: advertising_slot.purchased

automation.invoked.description: Whenever an automation is manually invoked (e.g. by a webhook or API call).
automation.invoked.name: automation.invoked

date.day.started.description: Whenever a new day starts. This event is fired at midnight UTC.
date.day.started.name: date.day.started

date.month.started.description: Whenever a new month starts. This event is fired at midnight UTC on the first day of each month.
date.month.started.name: date.month.started

date.week.started.description: Whenever a new week starts. This event is fired at midnight UTC on Monday.
date.week.started.name: date.week.started

date.year.started.description: Whenever a new year starts. This event is fired at midnight UTC on January 1st.
date.year.started.name: date.year.started

email.created.description: Whenever a new email is created and begins delivery. Note that event happens immediately before the emails themselves are sent.
email.created.name: email.created

email.deleted.description: Whenever an email has been deleted.
email.deleted.name: email.deleted

email.sent.description: Whenever an email has finished its delivery. Note that event happens immediately after all emails have been sent, but some email events may not have finished processing.
email.sent.name: email.sent

email.status.changed.description: Whenever an email's status has changed (e.g. from 'draft' to 'sent'.) The `metadata` field will contain the previous and new statii in 'old_value' and 'new_value' respectively.
email.status.changed.name: email.status.changed

email.updated.description: Whenever an email's content or metadata has been updated.
email.updated.name: email.updated

external_feed_item.created.description: Whenever a new item is created in an [RSS feed](https://docs.buttondown.com/rss-to-email).
external_feed_item.created.name: external_feed_item.created

firewall.blocked.description: Represents an incoming request that was blocked by the [firewall](https://docs.buttondown.com/firewall).
firewall.blocked.name: firewall.blocked

memberful.subscription.deleted.description: Whenever a subscription is deleted in Memberful.
memberful.subscription.deleted.name: memberful.subscription.deleted

mention.created.name: mention.created

stripe.checkout.session.completed.description: Whenever a Stripe checkout session is completed successfully.

stripe.subscription.deactivated.name: stripe.subscription.deactivated

subscriber.bounced.description: Whenever a subscriber's email is bounced.
subscriber.bounced.name: subscriber.bounced

subscriber.changed_email.description: When a subscriber's email address has been changed.
subscriber.changed_email.name: subscriber.changed_email

subscriber.churned.description: When a subscriber has unenrolled from your newsletter's paid offering.
subscriber.churned.name: subscriber.churned

subscriber.clicked.description: When a subscriber has clicked a link in one of your emails.
subscriber.clicked.name: subscriber.clicked

subscriber.commented.description: When a subscriber has commented on one of your emails.
subscriber.commented.name: subscriber.commented

subscriber.complained.description: Whenever a subscriber has complained about one of your emails.
subscriber.complained.name: subscriber.complained

subscriber.confirmed.description: When a subscriber has confirmed that they are enrolled in your newsletter. (For newsletters without double opt-in, this event is created immediately after `subscriber.created`.)
subscriber.confirmed.name: subscriber.confirmed

subscriber.created.description: Whenever a new subscriber is created.
subscriber.created.name: subscriber.created

subscriber.deleted.description: When a subscriber has been deleted from your newsletter.
subscriber.deleted.name: subscriber.deleted

subscriber.delivered.description: Whenever a subscriber's email is successfully delivered.
subscriber.delivered.name: subscriber.delivered

subscriber.opened.description: When a subscriber has opened one of your emails.
subscriber.opened.name: subscriber.opened

subscriber.paid.description: When a subscriber has enrolled in your newsletter's paid offering.
subscriber.paid.name: subscriber.paid

subscriber.paused.description: When a subscriber has paused their subscription.
subscriber.paused.name: subscriber.paused

subscriber.referred.description: When a subscriber has referred someone to your newsletter.
subscriber.referred.name: subscriber.referred

subscriber.referred.paid.description: When a subscriber's referral has converted to a paid subscription.
subscriber.referred.paid.name: subscriber.referred.paid

subscriber.rejected.description: Whenever a subscriber (or their email provider) has rejected an email from your newsletter. Buttondown takes rejections seriously, and will likely block the subscriber's email address from future emails and/or mark them as undeliverable.
subscriber.rejected.name: subscriber.rejected

subscriber.replied.description: Whenever a subscriber has replied to one of your emails.
subscriber.replied.name: subscriber.replied

subscriber.responded_to_survey.description: When a subscriber has responded to a survey in your newsletter.
subscriber.responded_to_survey.name: subscriber.responded_to_survey

subscriber.resumed.description: When a subscriber has resumed their subscription after pausing it.
subscriber.resumed.name: subscriber.resumed

subscriber.tags.changed.description: When a subscriber's tags have been modified.
subscriber.tags.changed.name: subscriber.tags.changed

subscriber.trial_ended.description: When the trial has ended for a subscriber.
subscriber.trial_ended.name: subscriber.trial_ended

subscriber.trial_started.description: When the trial has started for a subscriber. (For newsletters with automatic free trials, this will be created immediately after `subscriber.confirmed`.)
subscriber.trial_started.name: subscriber.trial_started

subscriber.type.changed.description: When a subscriber's type has been changed.
subscriber.type.changed.name: subscriber.type.changed

subscriber.unsubscribed.description: When a subscriber has manually unsubscribed from your newsletter.
subscriber.unsubscribed.name: subscriber.unsubscribed

subscriber.updated.description: When a subscriber's notes or metadata has changed.
subscriber.updated.name: subscriber.updated

subscriber.viewed_checkout_page.description: When a subscriber has viewed your checkout page.
subscriber.viewed_checkout_page.name: subscriber.viewed_checkout_page

survey.cleared_responses.description: Whenever a survey's responses have been cleared.
survey.cleared_responses.name: survey.cleared_responses

survey.created.description: Whenever a new survey is created.
survey.created.name: survey.created

survey.deleted.description: Whenever a survey has been deleted.
survey.deleted.name: survey.deleted

survey.updated.description: Whenever a survey's content or metadata has been updated.
survey.updated.name: survey.updated

daily.description: Act every day, compiling a digest of new items.
daily.name: Daily

every.description: Act every single time a new item is added to the RSS feed.
every.name: Every new item

monthly.description: Act every month, compiling a digest of new items.
monthly.name: Monthly

weekly.description: Act every week, compiling a digest of new items.
weekly.name: Weekly

failing.description: Buttondown cannot retrieve items from this feed. It will continue to attempt to do so until it gives up, at which point the automation will be set to `inactive`.
failing.name: Failing

irrelevant.description: Items in an RSS feed are marked as irrelevant if they do not have a publish date associated with them or if the publish date came before the RSS feed itself was connected to Buttondown.
irrelevant.name: Irrelevant

processed.description: An email has been created for this item.
processed.name: Processed

skipped.description: Items in an RSS feed are marked as 'skipped' if the RSS feed itself is paused or inactive in Buttondown when the item is processed. To send this item, you must manually process & send it using Buttondown's writing interface.
skipped.name: Skipped

accepted.description: The invitation has been accepted by the recipient.
accepted.name: Accepted

declined.description: The invitation has been declined by the recipient.
declined.name: Declined

owner.description: Special status indicating the user is the owner of the newsletter.
owner.name: Owner

pending.description: The invitation has been sent but not yet responded to by the recipient.
pending.name: Pending

revoked.description: The invitation has been revoked by the sender before being accepted.
revoked.name: Revoked

date_invalid.description: The date provided is not valid or is in an incorrect format.
date_invalid.name: Date invalid

invalid_ordering.description: The ordering provided is not valid.
invalid_ordering.name: Invalid ordering

invalid_tag.description: The tag provided is invalid or does not exist.
invalid_tag.name: Invalid tag

classic.description: A plaintext template that puts emphasis on your content.
classic.name: Classic

naked.description: The email body itself is used as the template, with no outside scaffolding provided by Buttondown.
naked.name: Naked

plaintext.description: A plaintext (like, literally plaintext, no HTML at all) template for the truly minimalist.
plaintext.name: Plaintext

equals.description: The value is equal to the field.
equals.name: Equals

greater_than.description: The value is greater than the field.
greater_than.name: Greater than

less_than.description: The value is less than the field.
less_than.name: Less than

not_contains.description: The value does not contain the field.
not_contains.name: Not contains

not_equals.description: The value is not equal to the field.
not_equals.name: Not equals

admin.description: This subscriber was added by a member of Buttondown support staff.
admin.name: Admin

comment.description: This subscriber joined via commenting on an email.
comment.name: Comment

import.description: This subscriber was imported from another service.
import.name: Import

organic.description: This subscriber subscribed to your newsletter of their own volition.
organic.name: Organic

user.description: This subscriber was added by a user with write permissions for subscribers within the Buttondown dashboard.
user.name: User

blocked.description: Subscribers that were automatically blocked from signing up for your newsletter by Buttondown's automated filtering systems. You can review the subscriber's email address and make a decision about whether to allow them to subscribe.
blocked.name: Blocked

churned.description: Subscribers which were previously premium subscribers, but have since churned but are not unsubscribed. These subscribers receive public emails as well as teasers.
churned.name: Churned

churning.description: Subscribers who have elected to not renew their subscription to your newsletter and will become unpaid subscribers at the end of their current billing period.
churning.name: Churning

complained.description: Subscribers that have registered a complaint with their email provider. Buttondown will not try to send them any future emails; no action is required on your part.
complained.name: Complained

gifted.description: Subscribers that have been gifted free premium subscriptions.
gifted.name: Gifted

past_due.description: Subscribers who technically have active paid subscriptions, but have not paid their invoices in time.
past_due.name: Past due

paused.description: Subscribers that are on a temporary hold from their premium subscription, but are still subscribed to your newsletter.
paused.name: Paused

regular.description: Normal subscribers who have not unsubscribed or deactivated in any way.
regular.name: Regular

removed.description: Subscribers who have been explicitly removed by the newsletter (notably, this does not mean unsubscribers: use /v1/unsubscribers for that!)
removed.name: Removed

trialed.description: Subscribers that are temporarily receiving a premium subscription to your newsletter.
trialed.name: Trialed

unactivated.description: Subscribers who have not yet confirmed their email or opted in.
unactivated.name: Unactivated

undeliverable.description: Buttondown marks subscribers as undeliverable when we receive some sort of proof that this address does not exist, such as a suppression notification from one of our email providers or a [hard bounce](https://docs.buttondown.com/glossary-permanent-failure) from the host or mailbox itself. We don't try to deliver email to subscribers marked as undeliverable, but you can, in some cases, change their email address (e.g. if they've changed their email address in your CRM, or if you had a typo in their email address) to try and fix things.
undeliverable.name: Undeliverable

unpaid.description: Subscribers who have not yet purchased a subscription to your newsletter. Subscribers will only be marked as unpaid if you have turned off free subscriptions to your paid newsletter; otherwise, they will be marked as [Regular](/api-subscribers-type#regular).
unpaid.name: Unpaid

upcoming.description: Subscribers who have a premium subscription starting in the future.
upcoming.name: Upcoming

unsubscribed.description: Subscribers that have or have been unsubscribed from your newsletter.
unsubscribed.name: Unsubscribed

access_denied.description: Access to the subscriber's email was denied.
access_denied.name: Access denied

disabled.description: The subscriber's email account is disabled.
disabled.name: Disabled

does_not_exist.description: The subscriber's email does not exist.
does_not_exist.name: Does not exist

email_blocked.description: The subscriber's email address is blocked.
email_blocked.name: Email blocked

ip_blocked.description: The subscriber's IP address is blocked.
ip_blocked.name: IP blocked

ip_undeliverable.description: The subscriber's IP address is undeliverable.
ip_undeliverable.name: IP undeliverable

on_esp_denylist.description: The subscriber's email is on an ESP denylist.
on_esp_denylist.name: On ESP denylist

other.description: The subscriber is deemed undeliverable for an unknown reason.
other.name: Other

out_of_storage.description: The subscriber's mailbox is out of storage.
out_of_storage.name: Out of storage

problematic_url.description: The email contained a problematic URL.
problematic_url.name: Problematic URL

rate_limited.description: The email provider, i.e. Gmail, acknowledges the message, but is temporarily refusing to send the message due to overall volume coming from the sender. Sender can mean a number of different things. For instance, it can mean that your specific newsletter is sending a high amount of volume. It can mean your domain is sending a high amount of volume. Or, in rare cases, it can mean that Buttondown itself as an overall system is sending too much volume. You do not need to change or retry any errors you see due to rate limiting. Buttondown will automatically handle that. However, if you see this error come up often, consider more regularly sending your email at a specific cadence, i.e. weekly.
rate_limited.name: Rate limited

spam.description: The email was marked as spam.
spam.name: Spam

spf_failed.description: SPF validation failed for the email.
spf_failed.name: SPF failed

once.description: A subscriber can only respond to this survey once.
once.name: Once

once_per_email.description: A subscriber can respond to this survey once per email.
once_per_email.name: Once per email

email_already_exists.description: A subscriber with this email address already exists.
email_already_exists.name: Email already exists

email_has_been_changed_too_many_times.description: This subscriber's email has been changed too many times.
email_has_been_changed_too_many_times.name: Email changed too many times

email_invalid.description: The email address provided is not valid.
email_invalid.name: Email invalid

subscriber_type_invalid.description: The subscriber type provided is not valid.
subscriber_type_invalid.name: Subscriber type invalid

tag_invalid.description: The tag provided is invalid or does not exist.
tag_invalid.name: Invalid tag

name_already_exists.description: The name of the tag already exists.
name_already_exists.name: Name already exists

name_too_long.description: The name of the tag is too long.
name_too_long.name: Name too long

disabled.description: The webhook is disabled and will not receive events.
